summary: N is universally understood as the number of items in the list you  that means. Log n represents the amount  of times n is divided. So if our unsorted array is 16, then log n would be 4. Since we can divide  array, pick a number to be your pivot. This could be the first number, the last number, or the middle number. The number that is chosen as the pivot is then used to compare all values into one of each. Rinse and repeat until sorted.
